title: DAST On-Demand Scan - View Scans - "Saved" scan
description:
## Why are we doing this work

With the [`Scheduled` tab completed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341374), a single tab still needs to be implemented: `Saved` scans. We are actually moving the `Saved Scans` tab from the DAST configuration page here. The legacy tab needs to be preserved until we're ready to remove the `dast_view_scans` feature flag, so we're basically copying the existing tab and making a few adjustments to it.


## Relevant links

- [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993)
  - [Design 1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993/designs/On-demand_scans_-_saved_scans.png)

## Non-functional requirements

- [x] Testing:
  - [x] Polls for saved scans.
  - [x] Renders the list.
  - [x] Actions work as expected.

## Implementation plan

- [x] Fetches DAST saved scans.
  - [x] Presents the scans in a table with the following columns:
    - `Name`
    - `Target site`
    - `Scan mode`
    - `Actions`
  - [x] The following actions are available:
    - [x] `Run scan`
    - [x] `Edit scan`
    - [x] `Delete`

title: DAST On-Demand Scan - View Scans - "Scheduled" tab
description:
## Why are we doing this work

With the [`Running` and `Finished` tabs completed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341373), we have all 3 basic tabs ready. We can now look into the `Scheduled` tab which is a bit different.

## Relevant links

- [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993)
  - [Design 1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993/designs/On-demand_scans_-_scheduled_scans.png)

## Non-functional requirements

- [x] Testing:
  - [x] Polls for DAST scans.
  - [x] Renders the list.

## Implementation plan

- [x] Poll for DAST scans through the `Project.dastProfiles` endpoint.
  - [x] Leverage the `isScheduled` filter to get scheduled scans only.
  - [x] Present the scans in a table with the following columns:
    - `Status`
    - `Name`
    - `Scan type`
    - `Target site`
    - `Next run`
    - `Cadence`

title: DAST On-Demand Scans - View Scans - "Running" and "Finished" tabs
description:
## Why are we doing this work

By now, we should be ready to implement the `Running` and `Finished` tabs that look like the `All` tab.

## Relevant links

- [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993)
  - [`Running` tab design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993/designs/On-demand_scans_-_running_scans.png)
  - [`Finished` tab design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993/designs/On-demand_scans_-_finished_scans.png)

## Non-functional requirements

- [x] Testing:
  - [x] Both tabs trigger the correct query.
  - [x] Polling starts when the tab becomes active.
  - [x] Polling stops when the tab becomes inactive.

## Implementation plan

- [x] ~backend: Add the ability to filter pipelines by multiple statuses: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/74323
- [x] When the tab becomes active, start polling for pipelines.
  - [x] The pipelines query is similar to the one implemented in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341364 but filters the pipelines by status.
  - [x] The `Running` tab shows pipelines that are currently running.
  - [x] The `Finished` tab shows pipelines that are done running (passed, failed, stopped, etc.).

title: DAST On-Demand Scan - View Scans - Truncate table values
description:
## Why are we doing this work

With the [`All` pipelines tab implemented](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341364), we'll want to make sure long table values are properly truncated.

## Relevant links

- [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993)
  - [Design 1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993/designs/On-demand_scans_-_truncating_values.png)

## Non-functional requirements

- [x] Testing:
  - [x] Values are truncated if needed.

## Implementation plan

- [x] Assess whether [`app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/components/tooltip_on_truncate.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/components/tooltip_on_truncate.vue) can be used for this.
- [x] Truncate long table value (> 40 characters).
  - [x] Long values are truncated with an ellipsis.
  - [x] Hovering over the truncated value reveals a tooltip with the full value.

title: DAST On-Demand Scan - View Scans - "All" tab
description:
## Why are we doing this work

With the [tabs created](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341359), we can start implementing their actual logic. We'll start with the `All` tab which displays all DAST scans in paginated list.

## Relevant links

- [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993)
  - [Design 1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993/designs/On-demand_scans_-_all_scans.png)

## Non-functional requirements

- [ ] Testing:
  - [ ] Starts polling for pipelines.
  - [ ] Renders the list.
  - [ ] Renders pagination.
  - [ ] Pagination synced with the route.

## Implementation plan

- [ ] Poll the `Project.pipelines` endpoint to get DAST pipelines.
- [ ] Present them in a table with the following columns:
  - `Status`
  - `Name`
  - `Scan type`
  - `Target site`
  - `Start date`
  - `Link to pipeline`
- [ ] The list should be paginated and kept in sync with the route (`vue-router`).

title: Update bundler-audit to 0.9.0.1
description:
### Problem to solve

bundler-audit `0.9.0.1` is available, we should consider upgrading [our analyzer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/bundler-audit).

### Proposal

Please carefully check the [how to update the upstream Scanner](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/bundler-audit#how-to-update-the-upstream-scanner).

Or follow the default workflow:

- [ ] review the changelog
- [ ] update the pinned version (in the Dockerfile or script or template, the mileage may vary)
- [ ] make sure all test passes

### Testing

- [ ] Check relevant test projects leveraging bundler-audit and make sure QA pipelines are passing with this new version:
[QA projects for Dependency Scanning](https://gitlab.com/explore/projects?tag=GL-Secure-QA,Dependency+Scanning)

https://gitlab-org.gitlab.io/quality/ci/secure-test-project-orchestrator/ - Sort by `bundler-audit` , `bundler-audit-dependency_scanning` shows `Custom CA` and `ruby-bundler`

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

Our feature is leveraging the latest version (`0.9.0.1`) of bundler-audit.

### What is the type of buyer?

~"GitLab Ultimate"

### Links / references

Related to #325324.

title: DAST On-Demand Scan - View Scans - Empty tabs
description:
## Why are we doing this work

Once the [on-demand scans index page](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341356) has been created, we'll create the page's tabs with their empty states.

## Relevant links

- [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993)
  - [Design 1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993/designs/On-demand_scans_-_tab_empty_state.png)

## Non-functional requirements

- [x] Testing:
  - [x] Link to on-demand scans form renders properly.
  - [x] Each tab renders the empty state with the correct text.


## Implementation plan

- [x] Render a link to the on-demand DAST scan form in the top-right corner.
- [x] Render a `GlTabs` component.
  - [x] It replaces the primary empty state based on a condition (dummy boolean for now).
  - [x] It renders 4 tabs: `All`, `Running`, `Finished`, `Scheduled`.
  - [x] The 3 non-default tabs render specific empty states:
    - [x] `Running`: `There are no running on-demand scans`.
    - [x] `Finished`: `There are no finished on-demand scans`.
    - [x] `Scheduled`: `There are no scheduled on-demand scans`.

title: Extend Scheduled Scan Execution Policy to enforce scans on agents
description:
## Why are we doing this work

We want to allow customers to collect vulnerabilities from images in running Kubernetes clusters that are connected with GitLab through Kubernetes Agent, so they can understand their current security risk for images that were deployed without providing sensitive data to connect to the cluster.

You can find more about our motivation to work on this issue [here](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/3410#problem-to-solve).

This issue is about extending Scheduled Scan Execution Policy to support Cluster Image Scanning scan for `agents`. In %14.3 we have introduced similar functionality, but for `clusters`. Customer will be able to schedule a security scan of running containers on selected time and select which namespace and resource names should be scanned. The policy will look like the following:

```yml
scan_execution_policy:
  name: Run Cluster Image Scan
  description: This policy enforces container scans against a production cluster on a daily basis.
  enabled: true
  rules:
  - type: schedule
    agents:
      agent-name:
        namespaces: []
    cadence: 0 0 * * *
  actions:
  - scan: cluster_image_scanning
```

`namespaces` may optionally be provided in order to limit the scan to the given namespaces. If omitted, then all namespaces will be scanned.

## Relevant links
- [Epic](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/3410)
- [Design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/219173)


## Non-functional requirements
<!--
Add details for required items and delete others.
-->

- [ ] Documentation: add documentation to `doc/user/application_security/policies/index.md` with information how to configure policy to enforce scan with agents, (revert https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/91075)
- [-] Feature flag: no feature flag is needed as this is something that users will optionally select by including the GitLab CI template
- [-] Performance:
- [ ] Testing:
  - Test if you can configure policy to run on clusters connected through Kubernetes agent,


## Implementation plan

Use the GitOps module as an implementation reference.

1. Add a `server` package to `internal/module/starboard_vulnerability` which implements a `GetSecurityPoliciesToSynchronize` rpc.
   1. The server will poll the security policy API, checking for changes to the policies
   1. If the server returns 404, then it should be assumed that security policies are not available, but polling should continue.
   1. If there is an update available, send the new policies in the response to agentk (using new rpc objects in `internal/module/starboard_vulnerability/rpc`)
1. In `internal/module/starboard_vulnerability/rpc`, create a `PoliciesToSyncronizeWatcher`, which receives a gRPC request and a callback function to call with the returned data
   1. The watcher will use the auto-generated (via protobuf) gRPC client in order to poll KAS and send any received policies to the callback function
1. In `internal/module/starboard_vulnerability/agent/module.go`, add a `loadSecurityPolicy` callback function which receives `*agentcfg.StarboardCF`.
   1. When this function is called, the `workerHolder` will stop all workers and then create a new ones with the received configuration.
1. In `internal/module/starboard_vulnerability/agent`, create a Syncronizer with a `run` method which receives new policies on a channel.
   1. When new policies are received on the channel, check if they would change the configuration currently held by the worker.
   1. If the configuration has changed, call the `loadSecurityPolicy` callback function.
1. Create a new `securityPoliciesWorker`, which will be started alongside the existing worker. This worker will hold the `loadSecurityPolicy` callback as a struct field. **This worker should be started even when the agent's Starboard configuration is empty**. When this worker is run it will:
   1. Create a new channel to send security policies on
   1. Run the synchonizer, giving it the channel
   1. Start the watcher, passing a callback function which will send policies on the channel

title: DAST On-Demand Scan - View Scans - Index page
description:
## Why are we doing this work

This tracks the creation of a new page for showing DAST scans. We'll start by creating a basic page with an empty state and a link to the on-demand scans form.

## Relevant links

- [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993)
  - [Design 1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339993/designs/On-demand_scans_-_empty_state.png)
- [Similar implementation](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/32994)


## Non-functional requirements

- [x] Feature flag:
  - [x] Create the `dast_view_scans` feature flag. Introduced in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/69571.
- [x] Testing:
  - [x] Controller:
    - [x] Redirects to `/:namespace/:project/on_demand_scans/new` if the feature flag is disabled.
    - [x] Otherwise, renders the page and receives a link to the form.

## Implementation plan

- [x] Create the `/:namespace/:project/on_demand_scans` route.
  - [x] It redirects to `/:namespace/:project/on_demand_scans/new` unless the `dast_view_scans` feature flag is enabled.
  - [x] The `On-demand scans` nav item link to the new page if the feature flag is enabled.
  - [x] It renders a basic Vue component.
  - [x] The component renders an empty state with a link to the on-demand DAST scan form.

title: Refactor Board scope to GraphQL
description:
Board details should be fetched using GraphQL and Apollo, especially for Board scope handling.

Currently `boardConfig` is populated in `app/assets/javascripts/boards/index.js` from the haml template and REST API.

The fetching of Board should be done in `app/assets/javascripts/boards/components/board_form.vue`

epic.title: Refactor Issue Boards to use GraphQL + VueX

title: Improve empty state when artifacts fail to load
description:
<!-- This template is a great use for issues that are feature::additions or technical tasks for larger issues.-->

### Proposal 

When a pipeline completes in a Merge Request, we provide the option to show build artifacts. When there are none to show and there is an error loading artifacts, we place two alerts on top of each other, since each live within their own if statements.

![Screen_Shot_2021-09-15_at_10.05.42_AM](/uploads/f0d1d7b49c639f3bd3bfa3237edbe0dc/Screen_Shot_2021-09-15_at_10.05.42_AM.png)

We should only use the error one in this case, since it's a failure to load artifacts.

title: Investigate /pipelines/:pipeline_id/variables API for error budget for Pipeline Authoring
description:
https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/error-budgets/

### Overview

Building on the success of [338587](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/338587) for improvements to the error budget, we will be investigating how to improve upon the performance and optimize the `/api/projects/:id/pipelines/:pipeline_id/variables` API endpoint.

![image](/uploads/51b19c9e89ac2382ea7cb44bf7dbd2d3/image.png)

![Screen_Shot_2021-09-20_at_11.35.09_AM](/uploads/5f2478c8669a011ed1588ce743e882e1/Screen_Shot_2021-09-20_at_11.35.09_AM.png)

<details>
<summary>Click to expand</summary>

### Details

The intent is to identify and optimize ways for the noted endpoint to improve as it relates to the error budget

### The outcome

The expectation is that the times are reduced from the screenshots identified in this issue.
</details>

### Update

Error budget should not exceed 20 minutes for the month.

title: Header Search Refactor - Handle errors in the component
description:
## What/Why Based on the comments from @sheldonled here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/70016#note_680927818
Part of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297396
Added to the rollout plan: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297396#note_665578315 This is a global component so submitting page level errors with `createFlash` could be a bit confusing for end users. We should handle the errors in the component itself rather than with `createFlash` ## Proposal Add an error state in the vuex store and manage it in the ` ~/header_search/components/header_search_autocomplete_items.vue` with something like `GlAlert` rather than simply catching and firing a `createFlash`.

epic.title: Improve Navbar UX to improve discoverability and usefulness of Global Search

## Proposal

With the delivery of https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4619, we will be [deprecating](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/332957) the Group Export/Import functionality.

This deprecation should be noted in the app on the:
1. **Export group** section on the `Group > Settings > General > Advanced` page 
1. **Import group from file** section on the `New Group > Import Group` page

## Screenshot

#### Group Export

#### Group Import

title: Update a list of included parameters for Project Import/Export to use AttributesPermitter & allow-list approach (project)
description:
Transition Project Import model to use `AttributesPermitter` & allow-list approach when Importing. 

This will allow us to see if allow-list approach works as expected, if there are any issues that need to be fixed. 

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/37322 for reasons why. 

Proposed model: **Project**

Once completed, create a new issue to update the next batch of relations.

# Implementation plan

description:
### Why are we doing this work?

When discussing https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339507#note_681951933 it came to our attention that one might create a custom security scanner which would have a `report_type` of `generic`, if that happens then we would be unable to distinguish which Vulnerabilities were created via our GraphQL mutation and which were created by a security scan. 

### Implementation plan

* [ ] ~database create a migration that adds `origin:integer` with default value of `1`
* [ ] ~backend create `Enums::Vulnerabiliites.origins`
* [ ] ~backend adjust `Vulnerabilities::ManuallyCreateService` to set the origin to `api`

title: License Scanning doesn't handle gradle dependencies defined using implementation directive
description:
### Problem to solve 

The following [`build.gradle`](https://gitlab.com/dogle-scottlogic/license-checker-test/-/blob/1a5a5db9acbd383d9b0004700756bdf8e9070425/java-11-examples/jackson-fasterxml-demo/build.gradle#L15-19) file will result in no licenses found:

```gradle

apply plugin: 'java'
apply plugin: 'maven'
apply plugin: 'maven-publish'

sourceCompatibility = 11
targetCompatibility = 11

repositories {
    mavenCentral()
    mavenLocal()
}

dependencies {
    implementation 'org.slf4j:slf4j-api:1.7.30'
    implementation 'org.slf4j:slf4j-simple:1.7.30'
    implementation('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core:2.11.1')
    implementation('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind:2.11.1')
    implementation('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.11.1')
    testImplementation 'org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter:5.6.2'
}
```

This is because the above dependencies block uses the `implementation` directive. In order to retrieve licences, dependencies must instead use the `compile` directive:

```diff
dependencies {
-    implementation 'org.slf4j:slf4j-api:1.7.30'
-    implementation 'org.slf4j:slf4j-simple:1.7.30'
-    implementation('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core:2.11.1')
-    implementation('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind:2.11.1')
-    implementation('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.11.1')
+    compile 'org.slf4j:slf4j-api:1.7.30'
+    compile 'org.slf4j:slf4j-simple:1.7.30'
+    compile('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core:2.11.1')
+    compile('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind:2.11.1')
+    compile('com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:2.11.1')
    testImplementation 'org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter:5.6.2'
}
```

### Implementation Plan

1. [x] Create a `gradle` integration test which demonstrates the described bug. This should probably be added to [`spec/integration/java/gradle_spec.rb`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/license-finder/-/blob/b7352580ff345217768b8e4f19262f27a93cc102/spec/integration/java/gradle_spec.rb), but this needs to be confirmed.
1. [x] Add a gradle init script to `license-finder` which can be executed at scan time to set the dependency configuration `runtimeClasspath` by default - this works for both `compile` and `implementation`
1. [ ] ~~Additionally update the init script so that the dependency configuration can be supplied to the analyzer via environment variable.~~
1. [x] Update the tests with cases applying the init script and configuring the `dependencyConfiguration` directive.

Tested init script which works:
```bash
./gradlew  --init-script init.gradle downloadLicenses
```

`init.gradle`:
```gradle
initscript {
  repositories {
    maven {
      url "https://plugins.gradle.org/m2/"
    }
  }

  dependencies {
    classpath 'gradle.plugin.com.hierynomus.gradle.plugins:license-gradle-plugin:0.15.0'
  }
}

allprojects {
  apply plugin: "java"
  apply plugin: com.hierynomus.gradle.license.LicenseReportingPlugin
  downloadLicenses {
    dependencyConfiguration = 'runtimeClasspath'
  }

}
``` 

Generated licenses are in `build/reports/license`.

### User experience goal

Current license scanning limitation is resolved _or_ documented.

### Further details

This will solve issues such as the one described in [License Scanning reports no license for some complex Gradle projects](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/322127)

### What does success look like?

License scanning should be able to display licenses for packages defined using an `implementation` directive, _or_ this shortcoming should be documented with a workaround provided.

### What is the type of buyer?

~"GitLab Ultimate" ~"Enterprise Edition" 

### Is this a cross-stage feature?

No, this only affects ~"Category:License Compliance" 

/cc @gonzoyumo @NicoleSchwartz

title: Missing warnings that GPG keys are exposing users verified email
description:
**[HackerOne report #1335671](https://hackerone.com/reports/1335671)** by `joaxcar` on 2021-09-10, assigned to @ngeorge1:

[Report](#report) | [Attachments](#attachments) | [How To Reproduce](#how-to-reproduce)

## Report

#####  Summary

This might not be that much of an implementation problem rather than a documentation problem. The documentation for creating and using GPG keys for verifying commits fail to mention that any email used in a GPG will be publicly available (even for public users that does not have an account on the instance). The [documentation for GPG keys](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/repository/gpg_signed_commits/) on GitLab mentions that you have to use a verified email from your account:

> One of the emails in the GPG key must match a verified email address used by the committer in GitLab. 

![gitlab.png](https://h1.sec.gitlab.net/a/3c8cb2b8-0e79-4d15-8da2-e1646d9b71ea/gitlab.png)

and

> Enter your real name, the email   
address to be associated with this key (should match a verified email address you use in GitLab) and an optional comment

The site does not contain any warning that the public GPG key will expose this email. As a reference, GitHub has a note:

> To keep your email address private, use your GitHub-provided no-reply email address. For more information, see "Verifying your email address" and "Setting your commit email address."

![github.png](https://h1.sec.gitlab.net/a/4a323ae5-0ef3-4e5a-bffc-0d1ac08c7595/github.png)

This kind of warning should be present in GitLab as well. As GitLab actually provides a "private" no-reply email for all users (see [documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/profile/#use-an-automatically-generated-private-commit-email)) which does count as a verified email, this should be mentioned in the GPG instructions.

The problem is that public GPG keys contain the linked email address. And as this email is enforced to be a verified email on the user account, the risk is that a user adds its primary email without realizing that this will now be exposed publicly even for unauthenticated visitors. If a user is only contributing verified commits in a private project the user might use a regular email as the commits would be out of reach for non-members of the project. The GPG key is still displayed on the user's profile page for everyone to see.

As mentioned, this is how GPG works, so it's up to the users to decide if they want to expose their email. But the information should be clearly mentioned in the documentation. As the key is visible by unauthenticated visitors to the instance even if registration is restricted.

#####  Steps to reproduce

1. Log in as a user "user01"  
2. Add a GPG key following this guide: [link](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/repository/gpg_signed_commits/#generating-a-gpg-key)  
3. Log out of gitlab  
4. Go to https://gitlab.domain.com/user01.gpg  
5. Save the key in a file on your local machine  
6. Run this command in a terminal  
```  
gpg --list-packets <FILE_PATH> | grep '@'  
```  
The email will be shown in the terminal

#####  Impact

Users might accidentally revel their verified emails through public GPG keys

#####  Examples

Test on my account key https://gitlab.com/joaxcar-test03.gpg

#####  What is the current *bug* behavior?

There is no warnings about GPG keys reveling verified emails

#####  What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The documentation should mention that adding a GPG key will break the privacy of the email used

#####  Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com

####  Impact

Missing warnings could lead to users accidentally reveling their verified emails through public GPG keys

## Attachments

**Warning:** Attachments received through HackerOne, please exercise caution!

* [gitlab.png](https://h1.sec.gitlab.net/a/3c8cb2b8-0e79-4d15-8da2-e1646d9b71ea/gitlab.png)
* [github.png](https://h1.sec.gitlab.net/a/4a323ae5-0ef3-4e5a-bffc-0d1ac08c7595/github.png)

## How To Reproduce

Please add [reproducibility information] to this section:

1.
1.
1.

[reproducibility information]: https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/security/#reproducibility-on-security-issues

title: VSA JS Error`cannot read suggestionsListClass of undefined `
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary



While validating https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/340276 on ~"workflow::staging", I noticed a JS console error, this is confirmed on master as well, while it doesnt affect usage of the page, it would be good to fix this error.

It looks like this is an instance of this [known issue](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/fe_guide/troubleshooting#using-vue-component-issues). This doesnt happen in group VSA since we have an apollo client there, but we dont use apollo in project VSA.

Related to #326701 since that introduced the filter bar to project VSA

### Steps to reproduce

1. Navigate to [Value stream analytics, for any project](https://staging.gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/value_stream_analytics)
1. Open the web console
1. A JS error should appear

### Example Project

https://staging.gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/value_stream_analytics

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

An error appears

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

No JS errors on page load

### Possible fixes

As per the troubleshooting link, adding a blank `apolloProvider` will fix this
```patch
diff --git a/app/assets/javascripts/cycle_analytics/index.js b/app/assets/javascripts/cycle_analytics/index.js
index 620da0104e0..34ef03409b8 100644
--- a/app/assets/javascripts/cycle_analytics/index.js
+++ b/app/assets/javascripts/cycle_analytics/index.js
@@ -45,6 +45,7 @@ export default () => {
   new Vue({
     el,
     name: 'CycleAnalytics',
+    apolloProvider: {},
     store,
     render: (createElement) =>
       createElement(CycleAnalytics, {

```

| Without apolloProvider | With apolloProvider | 
| --- | --- |
|![Screen_Shot_2021-09-20_at_1.18.38_pm](/uploads/8f341c37741ef39f1fd8d364d378e55e/Screen_Shot_2021-09-20_at_1.18.38_pm.png)|![Screen_Shot_2021-09-20_at_1.17.38_pm](/uploads/8861f7095f9e66eed2af28d694129334/Screen_Shot_2021-09-20_at_1.17.38_pm.png)|

title: Reschedule pending RecalculateVulnerabilitiesOccurrencesUuid jobs
description:
### Why are we doing this work?

With https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/68200 we rescheduled UUID recalculation background migrations due to a bug which got fixed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/67578.

According to our `background_migration_jobs` table we still 1700 jobs that are pending.
<details>
<summary>Query results from gprd-db-archive-console</summary>

```
gitlabhq_production=> SELECT COUNT(*) FROM background_migration_jobs WHERE class_name = 'RecalculateVulnerabilitiesOccurrencesUuid' AND status = 0;
 count 
-------
  1700
(1 row)
```
</details>

We tried to investigate the failure but Kibana [had no logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/goto/d7bbe99d89ebf32317870650d0001fd7) for the job in that period. We also investigated to see if there are any exceptions in Sentry but also failed to find anything.

There are 895 records that still have UUIDv4 which is another pain point for us.

<details>
<summary>Query results from gprd-db-archive-console</summary>

```
gitlabhq_production=> SELECT COUNT(*) FROM vulnerability_occurrences WHERE uuid ~* '^[0-9A-F]{8}-[0-9A-F]{4}-[4][0-9A-F]{3}-[89AB][0-9A-F]{3}-[0-9A-F]{12}$';                                       count 
-------
   895
```
</details>
 

In addition there are some old records for the UUID recalculation so we need to drop them before rescheduling.

### Implementation plan

1. ~database Create a post deployment migration to remove pending jobs older than 2021-08-18
2. ~database Create a post deployment migration to reschedule remaining RecalculateVulnerabilitiesOccurrencesUuid jobs

title: Importing group as a top level group targeting an existing namespace give false positive status
description:
### Summary When using the group import from other GitLab instance to GitLab.com. If the target group namespace already exist, the import will start and complete successfully but if the user who import the project try to access the namespace, it will result in a 404 because the target namespace has already been taken and owned by other users on the target instance. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Have a group in a Self-Managed GitLab instance (`kebab` in the screenshot`) 1. Try to import the group onto a different instance using a different name or the same name that's already being used (`totallyprivate` in the screenshot) 1. Observe that the import process has a green ticket which give the impression that the import was successfully complete 1. Try to navigate to the target group and see the 404 source group is owned by userA while the target group is owned by userB ### Example Project https://gitlab.com/totallyprivate ### What is the current *bug* behavior? Group import status is completed even though nothing is imported because the target namespace already exist ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? Group import status should ask the customer to use a different namespace before start importing. ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ![image](/uploads/9b5d286d119bbd369bca9422e382ce04/image.png) ### Output of checks This bug happens on GitLab.com; GitLab Enterprise Edition 14.3.0-pre 0e3a3aa512e #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
### Possible fixes

title: Deployment buttons are missing from environment page and grouped view when accessed as deployment-only users
description:
### Summary Actionable buttons(re-deploy & rollback) are missing from [Projects::EnvironmentsController:show](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/v14.2.4-ee/app/controllers/projects/environments_controller.rb#L74-76)(**Deployments > Environments > Environment**) page for protected environments when accessed as users with [deployment-only access](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/environments/protected_environments.html#deployment-only-access-to-protected-environments). Buttons are missing from the `grouped` environments view as well(**Deployments > Environments > group folder > 'Show all'**). Example URL: `https://gitlab.example.com/project/environments/-/environments/folders/review` As a work-around, deployment-only users can use any of the following pages: - Job page. - [Environments index](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/v14.2.4-ee/app/controllers/projects/environments_controller.rb#L31)(**Deployments > Environments**) page. ### Steps to reproduce - Set up [Deployment-only access to protected environments](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/environments/protected_environments.html#deployment-only-access-to-protected-environments) for a user to a protected environment. - Run a deployment as any user. - Try accessing the `show` page(**Deployments > Environments > Environment**) of the above environment as the above user. It will not show re-deploy button. - Try accessing the same page as a maintainer user, it will show the available buttons(re-deploy or rollback). To reproduce this for grouped view, - Run two deployments with environment names `test-folder/env1` and `test-folder/env2`. - Now go to **Deployments > Environments > test-folder > 'Show all'** - You'll find the re-deployment button missing if the view is accessed as deployment-only user. Button shows correctly for maintainer users. I feel this is a ~bug , but I'll leave it to the product team to decide whether this request should be treated as a ~feature proposal. ### What is the current *bug* behavior? #### Describe what actually happens: Deployment buttons are missing when accessing the environment page and grouped environments page as deployment-only users. #### Describe what you should see instead: Deployment buttons should show up when accessing the environment page and grouped environments page as deployment-only users. ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ### Output of checks #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
## Root cause The [rollback button partial](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/projects/deployments/_rollback.haml) requires `create_deployment` permission in order to be visible, which a reporter does not have. ## Proposal A couple of options are discussed in the comments: - `enable :create_deployment` when a reporter has access to a protected environment - https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341182#note_1119814828 - Check the `play_build` permission instead - https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341182#note_1120550020

title: [BE] Enhancements to Subscription History Table
description:
## User Story

As product owner, I want to build a subscription history table that informs the user of all activations related to the subscription.  This includes past, current and future dated.

## Acceptance Criteria

The subscription history table presents a set of activation records for the subscription as follows:
* Add an `Added on` Column - that denotes when the user activated and added the license to the instance
* Add an (i) info account with a tooltip in the Name column that displays billing persons email address and underneath that, the company name.
* Remove the `Email` column
* Remove the `Company` column

## Design

![futureDated](/uploads/b856fdfb0808742d0d69446d3423fded/futureDated.png)

title: [FE] Enhancements to Subscription History Table
description:
## User Story

As product owner, I want to build a subscription history table that informs the user of all activations related to the subscription.  This includes past, current and future dated.

## Acceptance Criteria

The subscription history table presents a set of activation records for the subscription as follows:
* ~~Add an `Added on` Column - that denotes when the user activated and added the license to the instance~~ No longer relevant, please see comment here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341171#note_774020206
* Add an (i) info account with a tooltip in the Name column that displays billing persons email address and underneath that, the company name.
* Remove the `Email` column
* Remove the `Company` column
* Add future-dated licenses to the subscription history table

Research issue here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/334426

## Design

![futureDated](/uploads/d54d6d8e4e38f7bb0febb016ad036e6d/table-1.png)

### Availability & Testing

<!-- This section needs to be retained and filled in during the workflow planning breakdown phase of this feature proposal, if not earlier.

What risks does this change pose to our availability? How might it affect the quality of the product? What additional test coverage or changes to tests will be needed? Will it require cross-browser testing?

Please list the test areas (unit, integration and end-to-end) that needs to be added or updated to ensure that this feature will work as intended. Please use the list below as guidance.
* Unit test changes
* Integration test changes
* End-to-end test change

See the test engineering planning process and reach out to your counterpart Software Engineer in Test for assistance: https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/test-engineering/#test-planning -->

Model tests, view and controller tests should be added alongside frontend Vue specs to ensure the following:

- Rails model associations
- Controller / view rendering of the new columns
- Tooltip test, any Vue component tests

title: Support Java 17 for Dependency Scanning
description:
<!-- This issue template can be used as a great starting point for feature requests. The section "Release notes" can be used as a summary of the feature and is also required if you want to have your release post blog MR auto generated using the release post item generator:  https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#release-post-item-generator. The remaining sections are the backbone for every feature in GitLab.

The goal of this template is brevity for quick/smaller iterations. For a more thorough list of considerations for larger features or feature sets, you can leverage the detailed [feature proposal](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/.gitlab/issue_templates/Feature%20proposal%20-%20detailed.md). -->

### Release notes

We have added support for Java 17 to Dependency Scanning. Thank you to the assistance of community contributors @rpandini_wh and @gliDom. If you are using the latest, or latest major(2), the container you do not need to do anything to receive this update. If you have pinned your container to a minor or specific version please update to at least 2.26.0 receive this update.

### Problem to solve

Dependency Scanning currently supports Java up to version 16. Version 17 made it to general availability [recently](https://www.oracle.com/news/announcement/oracle-releases-java-17-2021-09-14/) (2021-09-14) and should be supported as well.

### Related details

See [this comment](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/157/diffs#note_824274749) for more details.

### Proposal

Add Java 17 support for Dependency Scanning, without introducing any breaking changes.

### Implementation Plan

1. [x] Update [.tool-versions](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/blob/cfa64550757f3626983c4b752d192fce32bb12f6/config/.tool-versions#L5) in `gemnasium-maven` and add `gradle 7.3.3`, keeping gradle `6.7.1` as the default (the first listed version is the default):

   ```diff
   - gradle 6.7.1
   + gradle 6.7.1 7.3.3
   ```

   https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/164

1. [x] Update [.tool-versions](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/blob/cfa64550757f3626983c4b752d192fce32bb12f6/config/.tool-versions#L2) in `gemnasium-maven` and add `adoptopenjdk-17.0.2+8` to the list of Java versions:

   ```diff
   - java adoptopenjdk-11.0.7+10.1 adoptopenjdk-8.0.252+9.1 adoptopenjdk-13.0.2+8.1 adoptopenjdk-14.0.1+7.1 adoptopenjdk-15.0.2+7 adoptopenjdk-16.0.0+36
   + java adoptopenjdk-11.0.7+10.1 adoptopenjdk-8.0.252+9.1 adoptopenjdk-13.0.2+8.1 adoptopenjdk-14.0.1+7.1 adoptopenjdk-15.0.2+7 adoptopenjdk-16.0.0+36 adoptopenjdk-17.0.2+8
   ```

   https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/164

1. [x] Update [analyzer-wrapper](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/blob/cfa64550757f3626983c4b752d192fce32bb12f6/analyzer-wrapper#L31) so that if a user configures `DS_JAVA_VERSION=17`, we automatically select `gradle 7.3.3`

   https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/164

1. [x] Update [`utils/gradle-plugin-builder/build.gradle`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/blob/cfa64550757f3626983c4b752d192fce32bb12f6/utils/gradle-plugin-builder/build.gradle#L5) to use `gradle 7` syntax:

   ```diff
   - runtime group: 'com.gemnasium', name: 'gradle-plugin', version: '0.3.5'
   + runtimeOnly group: 'com.gemnasium', name: 'gradle-plugin', version: '0.3.5'
   ```

   https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/164

1. [x] Add the following downstream QA tests to the [java-gradle](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/java-gradle) test project:

   - [x] Test against a `Java 17` project without a `gradlew` file and show that it automatically siwtches to the pre-installed `gradle 7.3.3`

      https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/java-gradle/-/jobs/2160792124

      ```shell
      Using java version 'adoptopenjdk-17.0.2+8'
      Using gradle version '7.3.3'
      ```      

   - [x] Test against an older Java version, such as `Java 14`, and show:
      - [x] if no `gradlew` file is provided, `gradle 6.7.1` will be used

         https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/167

      - [x] if a `gradlew` file is provided that contains Gradle version `7.3`, the tests still pass

         https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/java-gradle/-/jobs/2160792098

         ```shell
         Using java version 'adoptopenjdk-14.0.1+7.1'
         Welcome to Gradle 7.3!
         Job succeeded
         ```

   It's important to add tests for projects that don't have a `gradlew` wrapper file with a pinned version of gradle. This shows that a `Java 17` project uses `gradle 7.3.3`, and a `Java 14` project uses `gradle 6.7.1`.

   If we were to use a pinned version of gradle in a `gradlew` file, then it wouldn't show us that the version of gradle changes programmatically based on the version of Java, which is what we need to demonstrate.

   See [this MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/157) for a starting point.

1. [x] Add the following downstream QA test to the [java-maven](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/java-maven) test project:

   - [x] Test against a `Java 17` project

      https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/java-maven/-/jobs/2160792198

   See [this MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/145) as a starting point.

1. [x] Add `Java 17` to the [Supported languages and package managers](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/application_security/dependency_scanning/#supported-languages-and-package-managers) table in the Dependency Scanning docs.

   https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/82276   

1. [x] Make the following changes to the [Obtaining dependency information by running a package manager to generate a parsable file](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/application_security/dependency_scanning/#obtaining-dependency-information-by-running-a-package-manager-to-generate-a-parsable-file) table in the Dependency Scanning docs:

   - [x] Add `gradle 7.3` to the `Tested Versions` column for the `Gradle` package manager.
   - [x] Add `gradle 7.3.3` to the `Preinstalled Versions` column for the `Gradle` package manager, and include a footnote explaining:

      > When `DS_JAVA_VERSION` is set to `17`, `gradle 7.3.3` will automatically be selected as the package manager.

   https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/82276

1. [x] Make sure to give credit to @gliDom for their community contribution in [Add support for java 17](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/150) which has provided some necessary details to help complete this issue.

### Proposal 

As mentioned in https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/job_logs.html, we renamed job trace to job log in GitLab 12.5, but we still often use the term `trace` internally because our code still uses the legacy name. title: Export comments in vulnerability report CSV
description:
<!-- This issue template can be used a great starting point for feature requests. The last section "Release notes" can be used as a summary of the feature and is also required if you want to have your release post blog MR auto generated using the release post item generator:  https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#release-post-item-generator. The remaining sections are the backbone for every feature in GitLab. -->

### Release notes 

<!-- What is the problem and solution you're proposing? This content sets the overall vision for the feature and serves as the release notes that will populate in various places, including the [release post blog](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/categories/releases/) and [Gitlab project releases](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/releases). " -->

### Problem to solve 

Our current CSV exports of vulnerability reports do not include any comment history. This makes is more challenging to know why a given vulnerability was closed or follow its activity history. Having the comments available helps with review and audit purposesâ€”especially for security teams that might not be working in GitLab yet. Having the comments is also very important in the US Federal government space as they often require the reason why a vulnerability was Resolved or Dismissed.

### Proposal 

Add to the CSV export a new `Comments` column. Vulnerabilities can have multiple comments, each associated with a different status change. We want to capture the full comment history as a vulnerability may have moved back and forth between statuses.

It will be somewhat awkward to serialize multiple comments into a single field in a row. To help keep the comments distinguishable, each should include:

* Comment author
* Comment timestamp
* Status associated with comment
* Comment

This might take a form similar to: "2022-09-28 01:02:03UTC::Author Name::Dismissed::Here is the Comment". Each comment information set will need a delimiter (not necessarily `::`) to separate these pieces of data. Multiple comments will also need another delimiter that is separate from the field delimiter and this new data delimiter. Comments might contain the field or new data delimiter or new comment delimiter so they should be sanitized, wrapped in double quotes, or any conflicting characters escaped to prevent accident delimiter confusion.

<!-- triage-serverless v3 PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS SECTION -->
*This page may contain information related to upcoming products, features and functionality.
It is important to note that the information presented is for informational purposes only, so please do not rely on the information for purchasing or planning purposes.
Just like with all projects, the items mentioned on the page are subject to change or delay, and the development, release, and timing of any products, features, or functionality remain at the sole discretion of GitLab Inc.*
<!-- triage-serverless v3 PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS SECTION -->

### Implementation plan

- [ ] Add a new mapping (for example `'Comments' => 'notes_summary'`) into the [existing structure](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/d9157918065904b61c136d395f450f96fb5a72fe/ee/app/services/vulnerability_exports/exporters/csv_service.rb#L8).
- [ ] Add a new method to return either the user that has edited notes or the author in case the note hasn't been edited as part of [note.rb](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/models/ee/note.rb).
- [ ] In [Vulnerability EE model](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/models/ee/vulnerability.rb):
    - [ ] Add a new scope to also include `:notes` which will be further used by the export service.
    - [ ] Add a new method (e.g., `notes_summary`) which will traverse `discussions` and each underlying `note`. status will be based on the first `note` of each `discussion`. It can be parsed out of the first `note` with something like `/\A[\w+\s]+to\s(?<status>\w+)/`.
    - [ ] Make sure the character being used as a delimiter is escaped/subbed from the content of `note.note`.
- [ ] Update the scope of `vulnerabilities` under [export_service](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/d9157918065904b61c136d395f450f96fb5a72fe/ee/app/services/vulnerability_exports/export_service.rb#L58) to use the scope newly created (suggested as part of the previous steps).

Example of output [root-oct-7-2022_vulnerabilities_2022-10-26T1615.csv](/uploads/78a239ae765a7b5d521b7d1936e2a0bb/root-oct-7-2022_vulnerabilities_2022-10-26T1615.csv)

title: Fix dead condition as resetting CI minutes usage is always successful
description:
## Problem

When an admin attempts to reset CI minutes consumption for a namespace we use `Ci::Minutes::ResetUsageService#execute`. This service always returns `true` since underneath it uses `update_all` which returns a truthy value (the count of updated records).

In the controller where we use the service object we check for the output of the service. If `true` we return a success message to the user. If `false` we return an error. The `false` scenario can't occur in reality, unless an exception is raised, but it won't be rescued gracefully.

We realized about this when resetting CI minutes notifications for new monthly tracking: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/69063#note_679747397. 

## Solution

Consider either:
- removing the `if` statement in the controllers `Admin::GroupsController#reset_runner_minutes` and `Admin::UsersController#reset_runner_minutes` to always return a success message
- rescue exceptions in `Ci::Minutes::ResetUsageService` and return `false`

title: Advanced Search: Problem with 1-step mapping update and backfill
description:
While working on https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/70042 I noticed a problem with the [`AddUpvotesToMergeRequests`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/ee/elastic/migrate/20210722112600_add_upvotes_to_merge_requests.rb#L3) migration and with the 1-step approach of adding mappings & backfill:

1. GitLab is updated
1. Sidekiq nodes pick up the [new `upvotes` field](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/e716bb0339f6ecba8a61ab57839c3c2dc3e33cb6/ee/lib/elastic/latest/merge_request_instance_proxy.rb#L32) right away since it doesn't have `if Elastic::DataMigrationService.migration_has_finished?(:add_upvotes_to_merge_requests)` condition
1. All the updates for merge_requests fail with `strict_dynamic_mapping_exception` since we have [`"mappings": { "dynamic": "strict" }`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/e716bb0339f6ecba8a61ab57839c3c2dc3e33cb6/ee/lib/elastic/latest/config.rb#L101) set.
1. This only stops when the migration runs the first time and mapping is updated, which might take up to 30 minutes if all migrations are up to date and more if there are other uncompleted migrations.

<details>
<summary>click to see failure</summary>

```
curl -H 'Content-type: application/json' -XPOST 'http://localhost:9200/gitlab-test-merge_requests/_doc' -d '{
 "id": 440,
 "iid": 1,
 "target_branch": "my-branch-2",
 "source_branch": "my-branch-1",
 "title": "My title 1",
 "description": null,
 "created_at": "2021-09-17T10:35:24.351Z",
 "updated_at": "2021-09-17T10:35:24.351Z",
 "state": "opened",
 "merge_status": "can_be_merged",
 "source_project_id": 894,
 "target_project_id": 894,
 "project_id": 894,
 "author_id": 906,
 "visibility_level": 0,
 "merge_requests_access_level": 20,
 "upvotes": 0,
 "type": "merge_request"
}'

{"error":{"root_cause":[{"type":"strict_dynamic_mapping_exception","reason":"mapping set to strict, dynamic introduction of [upvotes] within [doc] is not allowed"}],"type":"strict_dynamic_mapping_exception","reason":"mapping set to strict, dynamic introduction of [upvotes] within [doc] is not allowed"},"status":400}
```

</details>


---

## Proposed fix for AddUpvotesToMergeRequests

For the `AddUpvotesToMergeRequests` migration, I think we should create another migration only for adding upvotes mapping and set its version before `AddUpvotesToMergeRequests` and guard the [upvotes field](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/f5bf00dc72a9cfe7dec598d8d73c968ab4ce7ffa/ee/lib/elastic/latest/merge_request_instance_proxy.rb#L32) with `Elastic::DataMigrationService.migration_has_finished?(:...)`.

## General solution

I believe we should have 2 different helpers. One for adding mappings and another for the backfill and should always check if the mapping migration is completed in the `as_indexed_json` methods.

title: Instance-level DevOps Adoption: Using direct link spoils usage metric
description:
## Summary

When user visits instance devops report page without proper license incorrect usage event is sent. DevOps score page is rendered but `i_analytics_dev_ops_adoption` event is tracked instead of `i_analytics_dev_ops_score`

## Expected behavior

* `i_analytics_dev_ops_adoption` should be tracked only if the page actually renders. I.e. proper tab is selected + license allows page to be rendered. 
* `i_analytics_dev_ops_score` should be tracked if license doesn't allow DevopsAdoption OR `devops-score` tab is selected.

## Actual behavior

`i_analytics_dev_ops_adoption` is tracked when tab param is one of DevOps Adoption tabs regardless of license.

## Technical details

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/ee/app/controllers/ee/admin/dev_ops_report_controller.rb should be aware of license check when sending tracking event.

title: Ability to specify the jira environment type for the deploy step of my gitlab-ci.yml pipeline
description:
Hi there :wave:, my name is Remy and I am an engineer at Atlassian.

## Background and context

In January [gitlab began sending](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P7EDRaMRWPE) [deployment information](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-deployments/#api-group-deployments) to Jira through the [Gitlab marketplace app](https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221011/gitlab-com-for-jira-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview) :tada: :tada: :tada: 

The integration sends deployment events to jira based on the "deploy" steps defined in the `gitlab-ci.yml`:
```
deploy_staging:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - echo "Deploying strawberry service yay"
  environment:
    name: strawberry-test-env
    url: https://staging.example.com
```

When transforming the gitlab deploy step to the payload for the deployment event to send to jira a [transformation is applied](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/84dd0ca/lib/atlassian/jira_connect/serializers/environment_entity.rb#L22-35) which attempts a mapping from the freeform `strawberry-test-env` to the [deployment environment type](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-deployments/#api-group-deployments) defined in the public API.

Currently as outlined in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/334953 this mapping fails for free form text that does not match the [regex](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/84dd0ca/lib/atlassian/jira_connect/serializers/environment_entity.rb#L22-35) and defaults to 'unmapped'.


## Proposal

As a gitlab user I would like an optional field in a deployment step to specify the environment type for the deployment.

When a gitlab user provides this value, it is used instead of the attempted mapping from environment name.
```
deploy_staging:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - echo "Deploying strawberry service yay"
  environment:
    name: 'strawberry-test-env'
    type: 'staging' ## where type is optionally one of 'unmapped' | 'development' | 'testing' | 'staging' | 'production' as defined in Jira API.
    url: https://staging.example.com
```

We have been receiving feedback from GitLab && Jira customers using the [Atlassian Gitlab marketplace app](https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221011/gitlab-com-for-jira-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview) who are frustrated that their deployments are unmapped.

![image](/uploads/80024f63d4698076d86f12a53cb38a1c/image.png)

I think this improvement would benefit both Jira and Gitlab customers :smile: Please let me know what you think

title: Setting User Cap causes LDAP user to be blocked during first sign in
description:
### Summary

When LDAP is appropriately configured on a self-managed GitLab instance, a new user can sign in with their LDAP identity and have the account automatically created. If there are no "block auto-created users" settings enabled, the user can directly sign into GitLab on the first attempt.

However, if the "user cap" setting is specified, the user is redirected to the sign in page and shown a "blocked pending Approval" message: ![BlockedPendingApproval](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/e46d72028925a7325c7d0b7c1ab0aad0/BlockedPendingApproval.png) This happens even if the user cap is set to say 50 and the current number of users is 5.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Set up LDAP with GitLab SM.
1. Sign-up with new user via LDAP.
   * User account is created and user is signed in without any issues
1. Change User Cap settings in admin dashboard to some arbitrarily high number (say 100)
1. Sign in with another new user
   * User will be redirected back to sign in page with Blocked Pending Approval warning

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

On first sign-in via LDAP, new user is always blocked pending approval even if the billable user count does not exceed the user cap count setting, and the following message is shown:

`Your account is pending approval from your GitLab administrator and hence blocked. Please contact your GitLab administrator if you think this is an error.`

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

New user should be active if the billable user count does not exceed the user cap count setting.

### Investigating the source code

New user remains blocked pending approval if [`blocked_auto_created_omniauth_user?`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/7e749491133e4b8cc873f562925f1a3bb08bf009/ee/app/workers/set_user_status_based_on_user_cap_setting_worker.rb#L18) returns `true`.

```ruby
  def blocked_auto_created_omniauth_user?(user)
    ::Gitlab.config.omniauth.block_auto_created_users && user.identities.any?
  end
```

`::Gitlab.config.omniauth.block_auto_created_users` default is `true` and `user.identities.any?` returns `true` if the user sign-up via LDAP.

### Workaround

Explicitly change `omniauth.block_auto_created_users` setting in gitlab.rb to `false`.

**NOTE:** New user state is active, but blocked during first sign in. I think this is the same issue as #338980.

title: Failure in qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/repository/ssh_key_support_spec.rb | Unable to find link "E2E test key: key for ssh tests ..."
description:

```

May need to consider adding this to regular cleanup tasks.

`qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/web_ide/add_file_template_spec.rb`.

title: Add commit title to pipeline query
[Engineering] Update onboarding interview recruiting
description:
# Problem
GitLab PMs are trying to recruit namespaces that are just starting to utilize GitLab in order to better understand the bottlenecks that new users run into when first getting started with GitLab. At the moment we are not recruiting enough users to gain that insight.

## Details
As a result of the problems stated above we need to update some of the requirements in order to recruit more users and gain greater insights on the first mile of signup. see design here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/333977#note_672253640

## Requirements
1. Remove the team size limitation (we can start to recruit single user namespaces)
2. Update team (any namespace with more than 1 user) recruitment to include a $50 gift card incentive for completing their interview.
3. Update Calendly URL to https://calendly.com/d/n9wd-sy2b/gitlab-user-onboarding-research

## Proposed Design
![Screen_Shot_2021-09-16_at_2.14.50_PM](/uploads/875a2a02ea528ceafb3365375bba9f42/Screen_Shot_2021-09-16_at_2.14.50_PM.png)

**Changes:**
- Addition of two illustrations
- Change in content to reflect new incentive being offered.

[**Design File**](https://www.figma.com/file/U4HG8DlMsBactEiVA3Nkg4/Add-Ease-Score-and-Interview-Recruitment-Track-to-Onboarding-Email-Series?node-id=13%3A313)

## Implementation

- [x] Add new illustrations to [GitLab SVGs](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-svgs): https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-svgs/-/merge_requests/732
- [x] Update conditions of query params set in feedback URL (`/-/survey_responses`): https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/71809
   - [x] Remove `group.member_count > 1` condition when setting `show_invite_link`
   - [x] Set `show_incentive` when `group.member_count > 1` (at least 2 members)
- [x] Update the page: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/71809
   - [x] Use new Calendly URL
   - [x] Show chat illustration and copy if `show_invite_link` query param is `true`
   - [x] Show incentive illustration and copy if `show_incentive` query param is `true`

title: Secure Frontend Backlog Cleanup - Fernando
description:
This issue is for team member effort to clean up our backlog in %"14.4" related to https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6732

There are about 320 issues to go through and 4 engineers. My first pass I looked at the 80 oldest issues. And grouped them into the following groups:

1. Move Epic from "Backlog" to "Awaiting Further Demand"
1. Recommend Closing
1. Suggested for possible refinement.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1tnTA0D0xqyfZ8YPTXAgpEBkH0LE58hcykqrUbF-l9H8/edit?usp=sharing


## Approaches:



### Protect 

All feature work issues are promoted to epics, and assigned to current epic roadmap. If it doesnâ€™t fit into the existing epic roadmap, issue is closed.Â  Bugs, performance items, and tech debt remain as issues because they are typically small and self contained in one work item.

**Example:**Â 

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/5526 -> https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6846Â 

Youtube coffee chat: https://youtu.be/jaWo9Y7jqE0Â 

**Analysis:** Backlog is kept very small because Epics arenâ€™t issues. Issues are only created to reflect actual implementation work, and we usually donâ€™t create implementation issues until we are ready to work on them.Â 


---


### Experiment 1
Close out issue and apply labels auto closed and stale and vintage

**Example:**

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/6712

**Analysis:** Itâ€™s hard to know which issues are still desirable if we run a script. If we make assumptions about creation age and last activity we may blindly close issues that are still desirable. Requires manual intervention by subscribed parties to re-open.

---

## Experiment 2
Apply %Backlog milestone and the ~Accepting Merge Requests label and ~secure::parked.Â 

![Screen_Shot_2021-10-12_at_11.33.16_PM](/uploads/88809763121ca65b55c697513ed85c48/Screen_Shot_2021-10-12_at_11.33.16_PM.png)

Example:
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/5741
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/8636

**Analysis:**

Issues with ~Accepting Merge Requests in the %Backlog already exist. For this experiment Iâ€™ve created a ~secure::parked label so we can filter out our backlog search with label != ~secure::parked

We can run the script for issues older than a pre-determined time and with activity older than a pre-determined time and apply the ~secure::parked label while leaving the issue open

When looking for issues to work on we search the backlog for issues without the ~secure::parked label

Still requires manual analysis per issue to determine if we prefer to close it as no longer valid or desirable.

ï¿¼
---

## Experiment 3 

Leave open, move from %backlog to %awaiting further demandÂ 

â€œAwaiting further demandâ€ typically means an idea seems worthwhile but lacks validation or clear customer demand. Tend to put this on internal feature suggestions that donâ€™t have a clear line of sight to an existing feature or roadmap item or werenâ€™t the result of customer feedback.

**Examples:**
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/9382


**Analysis:**

Only a small subset of issues in the backlog fall into this category. Issues that contain a `TBD` Proposal section, or lack finer detail. Usually created by a PM or developer as an â€œideaâ€ to look into or further validate/follow up on.Â 

Requires manual analysis by a human to determine this outcome, hard to automate.

title: Object storage: Azure downloads don't have a Content-Disposition
description:
ZD: https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/227621 

When using Azure object storage with `proxy_download` set to `false`, downloading a named CI artifact doesn't send back a `Content-Disposition`:

![image](/uploads/cbf9f9178aaa10cf1485baa523791e77/image.png)

Steps to reproduce.

1. Configure Azure with consolidated object storage.
1. Be sure to set `proxy_download` to `false`.
1. Create a `.gitlab-ci.yml`:

```yaml
image: alpine:latest

test:
  script:
    - date
    - mkdir -p test
    - echo "hello2" > test/test.txt
  artifacts:
    name: ${CI_PROJECT_NAME}${CI_JOB_NAME}${CI_PIPELINE_ID}
    paths:
      - test
```

If you attempt to download the artifact, you see `download` appear as the filename:

![image](/uploads/60429840693aa1f3d44f5e9e541af35c/image.png)

Workaround is to set `proxy_download` to `true`.

This problem doesn't happen with S3 and Google Cloud Storage because the `response-content-disposition` parameter in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/a78d0b3f62f8da85a63b8e7eb67db60c20da1e0a/app/controllers/concerns/send_file_upload.rb#L13 is passed along as a query string to the request. Both Amazon and Google Cloud Storage honor this query string and return `Content-Disposition` in the HTTP headers, so this just works.

Azure behaves differently. Azure requires a `rscd` parameter in the SAS query string (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/service-sas-examples). [azure-storage-ruby](https://github.com/Azure/azure-storage-ruby/blob/05ea58af3859edda790e769be5beba7fcfb73c0f/common/README.md#shared-access-signature-generation) supports this [via the `content_disposition` parameter](https://github.com/Azure/azure-storage-ruby/blob/05ea58af3859edda790e769be5beba7fcfb73c0f/common/lib/azure/storage/common/core/auth/shared_access_signature_generator.rb#L83) in the `generate_service_sas_token` method. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-fog-azure-rm/-/merge_requests/25/diffs.

In addition, we need to modify CarrierWave to support these options:

```diff
diff --git a/config/initializers/carrierwave_patch.rb b/config/initializers/carrierwave_patch.rb
index c8c6f75949c0..70b3ce768349 100644
--- a/config/initializers/carrierwave_patch.rb
+++ b/config/initializers/carrierwave_patch.rb
@@ -49,7 +49,7 @@ def authenticated_url(options = {})
             local_file = local_directory.files.new(key: path)
             expire_at = options[:expire_at] || ::Fog::Time.now + @uploader.fog_authenticated_url_expiration
             case @uploader.fog_credentials[:provider]
-            when 'AWS', 'Google'
+            when 'AWS', 'Google', 'AzureRM'
               # Older versions of fog-google do not support options as a parameter
               if url_options_supported?(local_file)
                 local_file.url(expire_at, options)
```

title: [Feature flag] Enable namespace name sync with CustomersDot
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## Summary

This issue is to rollout [this feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/issues/2902) on production,
that is currently behind the `sync_namespace_name_with_cdot` feature flag.

### Context for the change

When the name for namespace changes in GitLab.com, no notice of the change is sent to CustomersDot.

As a result, the subscription information on `CustomersDot` gets out of sync and displays the outdated name within the customer's subscription page.

We want for the subscriptions in CustomersDot to display accurate information regarding its associated namespaces in Gitlab.com.

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::license" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_license`
- Best individual to reach out to:  Vladlena Shumilo (@vshumilo)
- PM: James Lopez (@jameslopez)

## The Rollout Plan

- Rollout Feature for everyone as soon as Sidekiq is updated and the introduced job is available. [More context](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/69896#note_678740904)

<!-- Which dashboards from https://dashboards.gitlab.net are most relevant? Sentry errors reports can also be useful to review -->

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

When the flag is enabled, every time a `EE::Namespace` object's name is updated, we will enqueue a `::Namespaces::SyncNamespaceNameWorker` that will take care of sending the updated name to CustomersDot so it is properly updated on that end.

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

The name will not be updated, we will be in the same situation we are today.

## Roll Out Steps

- [x] Enable on staging (`/chatops run feature set sync_namespace_name_with_cdot true --staging`)
- [x] Test on staging
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated
- [x] Coordinate a time to enable the flag with the SRE oncall and release managers
  - In `#production` mention `@sre-oncall` and `@release-managers`. Once an SRE on call and Release Manager on call confirm, you can proceed with the rollout
- [x] Announce on the issue an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com
- [x] Enable on GitLab.com by running chatops command in `#production` (`/chatops run feature set sync_namespace_name_with_cdot true`)
- [x] Cross post chatops Slack command to `#support_gitlab-com` ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#where-to-run-commands)) and in your team channel
- [x] Announce on the issue that the flag has been enabled
- [x] Remove feature flag and add changelog entry. Ensure that the feature flag definition YAML file has been removed in the **same MR** that is removing the feature flag from the code
- [x] After the flag removal is deployed, [clean up the feature flag](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) by running chatops command in `#production` channel

## Rollback Steps

- [x] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set sync_namespace_name_with_cdot false
```

title: Null value in column "public_email" violates not-null constraint
description:
## Problem to solve

Today @mksionek noticed a low-frequency error related to `User#public_email`.  See these results for the [Sentry search for "null value in column "public_email" violates not-null constraint"](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/?environment=gprd&query=null+value+in+column+%22public_email%22+violates+not-null+constrain):

- [15 events](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/2803777)
- [2 events](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/2804726/?environment=gprd)
- [6 events](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/2803114/?environment=gprd)

This error is occurring since [code to set `public_email` to an empty-string was recently removed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/68683/diffs#4ed0c03b53dbc8320da88e7887465514cd9e90a4_2017_2016).

## Additional information

Here is how User secondary emails are defined in SQL:

- `commit_email character varying`
- `notification_email character varying`
- `public_email character varying DEFAULT ''::character varying NOT NULL`

## Proposal

Define `public_email` the same way as the other 2 secondary emails: `public_email character varying`

title: Report Widgets Core: Add support for actions Level 2
description:
# Context

This is part of the epic: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6647 that adds support for the [Design Guidelines](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports) to the Core component of MR Report Widgets.

All this is in the context of the [Working Group: Merge Request Report Widgets](https://about.gitlab.com/company/team/structure/working-groups/merge-request-report-widgets/). 


## Required reading

Please ensure that:
* all the code written implements the rules of Accessibility https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#accessibility
* you're familiar with the overall goal https://www.figma.com/file/qEddyqCrI7kPSBjGmwkZzQ/Component-library?node-id=38193%3A30482

# Task

Add support for actions for Level 2.

![image](/uploads/7f02dc34a56e67f3226926ccbfd3f07e/image.png)

> 1.   **Info button** - provides supplemental information in a [popover](https://design.gitlab.com/components/popover/).
> 1.   **Options button** - at smaller breakpoints opens a dropdown with available actions. On hover/focus a [tooltip](https://design.gitlab.com/components/tooltip/) reads â€œ{widget} optionsâ€.
> 1.   **Download dropdown** - ability to download assets related to the widget. On hover/focus a [tooltip](https://design.gitlab.com/components/tooltip/) reads â€œ{widget} downloadsâ€.
> 1.   **Tertiary button** - actions that can be taken on or from the widget, like â€œManage licensesâ€ or â€œView reportâ€.
> 1.   **Expand/collapse button** - toggles the visibility of level 2 and level 3 items when present. On hover/focus a [tooltip](https://design.gitlab.com/components/tooltip/) reads â€œShow {widget} detailsâ€ when collapsed and â€œHide {widget} detailsâ€ when expanded.

in [Merge request reports | Pajamas Design System](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#actions)


**Please observe the responsive behavior (ellipsis)**: https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#responsive

title: Report Widgets Core: Add support for content sections Level 3
description:
# Context

This is part of the epic: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6647 that adds support for the [Design Guidelines](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports) to the Core component of MR Report Widgets.

All this is in the context of the [Working Group: Merge Request Report Widgets](https://about.gitlab.com/company/team/structure/working-groups/merge-request-report-widgets/). 


## Required reading

Please ensure that:
* all the code written implements the rules of Accessibility https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#accessibility
* you're familiar with the overall goal https://www.figma.com/file/qEddyqCrI7kPSBjGmwkZzQ/Component-library?node-id=38193%3A30482


# Task

Implement the content sections for Level 3:

* Status
* Subject
  * Section title and description
  * Text
  * Meta

![example](https://design.gitlab.com/img/mrw-subject.png)

* Section title and description - groups level 2 and level 3 status items. A description must be preceded by a title, but a title does not require a description.
* Text - identifies the item, what it means for a user, and how to remedy problems. It can contain inline links and formatting to emphasize text.
* Meta - supplemental text, links, and badges that add meaningful context to an item. Text can include formatting for emphasis.

See https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#content-sections

* all the code written implements the rules of Accessibility https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#accessibility
* you're familiar with the overall goal https://www.figma.com/file/qEddyqCrI7kPSBjGmwkZzQ/Component-library?node-id=38193%3A30482


# Task

Implement the content sections for Level 2:

* Status
* Subject
  * Section title and description
  * Text
  * Meta

![example](https://design.gitlab.com/img/mrw-subject.png)

* Section title and description - groups level 2 and level 3 status items. A description must be preceded by a title, but a title does not require a description.
* Text - identifies the item, what it means for a user, and how to remedy problems. It can contain inline links and formatting to emphasize text.
* Meta - supplemental text, links, and badges that add meaningful context to an item. Text can include formatting for emphasis.

See https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports#content-sections
